name: European walking route E2 west, UK, South East England

ai.summary: A challenging segment of the European walking route E2 across the South East of England, covering roughly 424 km. This route blends coastal paths, rolling downs, woodlands, reservoirs and lakes, with a demanding profile that tests stamina, navigation and planning.
ai.terrain_summary: Varied terrain including chalk downs, forests, river and lake shores, and reservoirs. Expect long days with occasional road crossings and moderate climbs; scenery ranges from open heath to wooded areas with several lake viewpoints.
ai.safety_notes: Navigation is essential; carry up-to-date maps and know the route. Weather in South East England can change rapidly—be prepared for rain, wind, or heat. Remote stretches have limited services; plan water, food and lodging in advance. Exercise care on coastal and road sections; watch for traffic. Seasonal hazards include fog, flooding after heavy rain, and icy patches in winter; carry an emergency contact method.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing (base layer, insulating layer, waterproof outer shell)
Water supply (hydration system or 2–3 liters; consider purification options)
First aid kit and blister care
Navigation device (GPS or offline maps on phone)
ai.best_seasons: Best from spring to autumn (roughly March to October). Spring and early summer offer milder weather and wildlife interest; autumn provides scenery changes but conditioning should account for variable conditions. Winter hiking is more challenging due to rain, wind and shorter daylight hours; some segments may have limited services.

seo.title: E2 West – South East England: European Walking Route Guide (UK)
seo.meta_description: Plan your hike on the E2 West section through South East England. About 424 km of challenging terrain with lakes, downs, and reservoirs. Safety tips, gear list, and best seasons.
seo.h1: European Walking Route E2 West – South East England (UK)
